title: About
text:
I grew up in Upstate New York and got my Bachelor of Science at the State University of New York at Albany. After graduating, I interned at the New York State Department of Health and volunteered at Wadsworth Arbovirology lab. I found my passion for microbiology and pursued my Ph.D.Â at The University of Maine, studying virus-host interactions.

When I am not at my desktop or teaching, you can find me hiking with my Australian Shepard, spending time with my family, or playing volleyball.

title: Welcome!
text: I am an Assistant Teaching Professor in Biotechnology and Bioinformatics at the Roux Institute at Northeastern University. Currently, my lab focuses on understanding viral mutation dynamics and using modeling techniques to predict human disease and tissue tropism; find our latest work, [here] (https://www.mdpi.com/1999-4915/17/1/12)!. In addition, I am passionate about integrating student learning into our research and community outreach to enhance and expand experiential learning opportunities.
